boardgame.description: Designed by Bruno Cathala and Ludovic Maublanc, Cleopatra and the Society of Architects is a fun and engaging family game that includes a true, three-dimensional palace that players compete to build. Players strive to become the wealthiest of Cleopatra_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s architects by constructing the most magnificent and valuable parts of her palace._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players, however, will be tempted to deal with shady characters and trade in materials of dubious origins in order to help them build faster. While these corrupt practices might allow an architect to stay a step ahead of the rest, they come with a high price _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; cursed Corruption Amulets honoring Sobek, the Crocodile-god. When Cleopatra finally strolls into her new palace, at the end of the game, the most corrupt architect (the one with the most amulets) will be seized and offered as a sacrifice to her sacred crocodile! Only then will the wealthiest architect, from among those still alive, be selected and declared the winner of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;The component design in Cleopatra is the most innovative we_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;ve undertaken to date,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; said Days of Wonder CEO, Eric Hautemont. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;While it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s still a board game, the dozens of 3D pieces _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; Column walls, Doorframes, Obelisks, Sphinxes, and Palace Throne _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; all create the sense that you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;re constructing a royal palace._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;The game play really forces players into continually weighing the risks and rewards between taking enough corruption to enhance your position in the game, but not so much that you are forced out of the game at the end,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; said the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s co-designer, Bruno Cathala. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s a classic _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;lsquo;push your luck_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo; dilemma that continually raises the tension level higher and higher until the game reaches its climax._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Description from the publisher._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

FRED Distribution (FDD 101055N) Cleopatra _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; the Society of Architects is a fun and engaging family game that includes a true, three-dimensional palace that players compete to build. Players strive to become the wealthiest of Cleopatra’s architects by constructing the most magnificent and valuable parts of her palace. Players, however, will be tempted to deal with shady characters and trade in materials of dubious origins in order to help them build faster. While these corrupt practices might allow an architect to stay a step ahead of the rest, they come with a high price - cursed Corruption Amulets honoring Sobek, the Crocodile-god. When Cleopatra finally strolls into her new palace, at the end of the game, the most corrupt architect (the one with the most amulets) will be seized and offered as a sacrifice to her sacred crocodile! Only then will the wealthiest architect, from among those still alive, be selected and declared the winner of the game. Contents: 1 3D palace: 9 column walls 2 door frames 2 obelisks 6 sphinxes 1 throne 1 pedestal 10 statues of Anubis 108 talents 89 amulets of corruption 110 resource and character cards 1 sculpted figure of Cleopatra 5 pyramids of corruption 5 dice of the Great Priest 1 rules booklet 1 online access number

Theme: Designed by Bruno Cathala and Ludovic Maublanc, Cleopatra and the Society of Architects is a fun and engaging family game that includes a true, three-dimensional palace that players compete to build. Players strive to become the wealthiest of Cleopatra’s architects by constructing the most magnificent and valuable parts of her palace. Players, however, will be tempted to deal with shady characters and trade in materials of dubious origins in order to help them build faster. While these corrupt practices might allow an architect to stay a step ahead of the rest, they come with a high price – cursed Corruption Amulets honoring Sobek, the Crocodile-god. When Cleopatra finally strolls into her new palace, at the end of the game, the most corrupt architect (the one with the most amulets) will be seized and offered as a sacrifice to her sacred crocodile! Only then will the wealthiest architect, from among those still alive, be selected and declared the winner of the game. Insurance is optional but highly recommended for higher priced items. The shipping costs are NOT inflated. You pay exactly what I am charged for shipping, along with material costs. I ship through FedEx or USPS, whichever is cheaper. Normal shipping costs run from $8.00 - $11.00. Payment: I accept PayPal, money orders, personal and cashier_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s checks. Personal checks will be accepted but I will wait until the check has cleared before sending the item. I will add 3.9% to the price when paying by PayPal. Return Policy: I want you to be completely satisfied with your item. Because of this, I will accept return of any item for a refund of the purchase price within 30 days of the sale. The item must be in the same condition that it was sent. I cannot refund the shipping cost.

Only listed as Like New because it is out of shrink and punched, but never played, only inventoried. I prefer paypal, but other arrangements for payment are possible if you geekmail me prior to adding the game to your cart and checking out. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll ship anywhere, but the buyer assumes all responsibility for shipping or post charges. I won_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t charge you any more than it costs me to ship it. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m listing a bunch of games this month and I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t do this professionally so please bear with me and be reasonable when it comes to shipping time. If you purchase and pay Friday evening my time, don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t expect the package to go out until Monday at the soonest. I should be able to go to the post office for simple domestic shipping several times a week, but I probably will consolidate all overseas shipments to one weekly trip. Check out my other games listed. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll do my best to offer multi-game order discounts and combined shipping, but I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m not making it a rock-solid offer because I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t want someone getting $5 off each additional game and then buying 10 card games or something that would only sell for $5-$10 anyways. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m trying to be generous to stir up sales, but not take a Net Loss on everything any more than I have to. If you have any other questions or would like to request that I put up a particular game from my collection, Geekmail me with a reasonable offer. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m kinda making decisions as I go along through my collection, so I would probably be willing to sell a game I was on the fence about if I knew there was a guaranteed sale imminent. Thanks!
